com.github.fge.largetext.load

Class DecodingStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.largetext.load.DecodingStatus

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class DecodingStatus
extends Object
    The "thread shepherd" for a text decoding operation

    This class handles two types of callers:

    • callers to CharSequence.charAt(int) and CharSequence.subSequence(int, int), via CharWaiters;
    • callers to CharSequence.length(), via its getTotalSize() method.

    The callers of the first two charsequence operations only need to wait for a given number of characters to be (successfully!) decoded, while the callers of the third need to wait for the whole decoding process to (successfully, again) terminate.

    This class maintains the first category of callers using a PriorityQueue of CharWaiter instances, and the second category with a single CountDownLatch.

    There is one such class per LargeText instance. It is created, and updated by, the (also unique) TextDecoder instance which is the decoding workhorse.

    See the documentation of each method for details on the inner workings.

    See Also:
    CharWaiter, TextDecoder.needChars(int), TextDecoder.getTotalChars()

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecodingStatus

        public DecodingStatus()

    • Method Detail

      • addWaiter

        public boolean addWaiter(CharWaiter waiter)
        Add (if needed) one CharWaiter to the queue of waiters

        Callers to CharSequence.charAt(int) may reach TextDecoder.needChars(int) which will create a CharWaiter instance and then call this method.

        The waiter is queue if and only if the number of currently available characters is less than what it requests for; in which case it will CharWaiter.await() for this class to wake it up.

        Parameters:
        waiter - the waiter to add
        Returns:
        true if and only if the waiter was actually queued, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - decoding was already finished, and waiter asked for more characters than what is available

      • setNrChars

        public void setNrChars(int nrChars)
        Update the number of available characters successfully decoded

        When this method is called, all waiters in the queue requiring this number of chars or less are dequeued and woken up (see CharWaiter.wakeUp().

        Parameters:
        nrChars - the number of available characters
        See Also:
        CharWaiter.setNrChars(int)

      • setFailed

        public void setFailed(IOException exception)
        Record a decoding failure

        When such a failure happens, all waiters (including callers to LargeText.length() are "woken up" with a LargeTextException; the cause of this exception is set to the exception passed as an argument.

        Parameters:
        exception - the exception raised by the decoding process
        See Also:
        CharWaiter.setException(IOException), getTotalSize()

      • setFinished

        public void setFinished(int nrChars)
        Notify that the decoding operation is finished

        This works very similarly to setNrChars(int), except that all waiters in the queue are woken up along with all callers of LargeText.length().

        The logic to handle the case where too many characters have been waited for is handled in CharWaiter.

        Parameters:
        nrChars - the number of available characters
        See Also:
        CharWaiter.setNrChars(int), CharWaiter.wakeUp()

      • getTotalSize

        public int getTotalSize()
        Method called by all callers of LargeText.length()

        Callers of this method will sleep and be woken up if one of three conditions happen:

        • the dedocing operation has successfully completed;
        • the current thread has been interrupted;
        • the decoding operation terminated with an error.

        In the two last scenarios, threads are "woken up" with a LargeTextException; the cause is set to the relevant error.

        Returns:
        the number of characters
        Throws:
        LargeTextException - caller has been interrupted, or decoding operation has failed

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
